thread.title: Malzahn goes visor-free to honor Spurrier, plans to donate signed visor to flood relief
thread.title_full: Malzahn goes visor-free to honor Spurrier, plans to donate signed visor to flood relief

title: Malzahn goes visor-free to honor Spurrier, plans to donate signed visor to flood relief
text:
7:51p ET 
Steve Spurrier may have left the world of college football coaching but his legacy will certainly live on through coaches like Gus Malzahn. 
Following Spurrier's retirement announcement, Malzahn admitted this week that he wears the visor during game days in honor of the former Florida and South Carolina head coach. 
Malzahn decided to honor Spurrier against Kentucky and go without a visor in Lexington. The visor Malzahn would have worn will instead be autographed and auctioned off in effort to help those in need affected by flooding in South Carolina. true â€” SEC Sports (@SEC) October 15, 2015 
"Coach Spurrier is one of the all-time greats and his influence on me and my coaching style goes back to my days as a high school coach when I started wearing a visor," Malzahn said. "I'm very appreciative for everything he's done for me and the game of football. He's played a large role in making Southeastern Conference football what it is today and will be missed. Going visor-free for tonight's game is a small way to pay respect to Coach Spurrier and help raise money and awareness for a great cause." MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our College Football newsletters.
